etymology.description: 魚(魚) (yú, 'fish') + phonetic: 羴(羴) (shān) = combination of fish and mutton implies high-quality, delectable food -> fresh
etymology.interpretation: The character combines 'fish' and 'mutton' to emphasize freshness and deliciousness, which are traits associated with high-quality food. This reflects cultural values of taste and quality in food.
etymology.simplification: 鮮(鮮) ('xiān, 'fresh') was simplified to 鲜 by replacing 魚(魚) with its simplified form 鱼(鱼) for ease of writing.

examples.chinese: 这家餐厅的鱼很鲜(這家餐廳的魚很鮮)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè jiā cāntīng de yú hěn xiān.
examples.english: The fish in this restaurant are fresh.

examples.chinese: 市场上有新鲜水果(市場上有新鮮水果)，吸引了很多顾客(吸引了很多顧客)。
examples.pinyin: Shìchǎng shàng yǒu xīnxiān shuǐguǒ, xīyǐn le hěn duō gùkè.
examples.english: Fresh fruits in the market attract many customers.

examples.chinese: 鲜汤清澈诱人(鮮湯清澈誘人)。
examples.english: The fresh soup is clear and appetizing.
